com.example.noteation.fragments

Class MapFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      • com.example.noteation.fragments.MapFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback

    public class MapFragment
extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
implements com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
    This class is in charge of showing the "location tasks" on the map and allowing the user to navigate to any place by sending the user to google maps with the location for directions, it also allows the user to create a new "location task"

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment

        androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.InstantiationException, androidx.fragment.app.Fragment.SavedState

      Gets all the tasks from the database and adds a marker and a circle to the map for each one, it also adds the latitude and longitude of the location to the geofences list

      Sets the initialized places from google maps to the search bar fragment, and sets an "onPlaceSelectedListener"
      private com.google.android.gms.maps.model.BitmapDescriptor bitmapFromVector(android.content.Context context, int vectorResId) 
      private void checkPermissions()
      Sends the fine location permission needed for the map, and checks if it's enabled, if it isn't then it asks for the permission, if it is then it asks the user to enable the fine location from the app's settings

      • onViewCreated

        public void onViewCreated(@NonNull
                          android.view.View view,
                          @Nullable
                          android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Before creating the map, we check if the user has all of the permission in order to load this map and use it. When all the permission are granted, the "init" method will be called in order to load the map
        Overrides:
        onViewCreated in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
        Parameters:
        view - Binds the fragment's view to the fragment class
        savedInstanceState - A reference to a Bundle object that is passed into the "onCreate" method of every android activity, the activity will have the ability, under special circumstances, to restore itself to a previous state using the data stored in this bundle

      • init

        private void init(android.view.View view)
        The "onCreate" method is in charge of initializing the map, the places in the search bar and on all the "onClickListeners".
        Parameters:
        view - The view of the fragment passed from "onViewCreated"

      • checkPermissions

        private void checkPermissions()
        Sends the fine location permission needed for the map, and checks if it's enabled, if it isn't then it asks for the permission, if it is then it asks the user to enable the fine location from the app's settings

      • autoCompleteSearch

        private void autoCompleteSearch()
        Sets the initialized places from google maps to the search bar fragment, and sets an "onPlaceSelectedListener"

      • onMapReady

        public void onMapReady(com.google.android.gms.maps.GoogleMap googleMap)
        Initializes the map (it cannot be initialized directly, only threw this method) and sets the map at our current location if possible, if not it shows a toast of the exception
        Specified by:
        onMapReady in interface com.google.android.gms.maps.OnMapReadyCallback
        Parameters:
        googleMap - The map to initialize our "mMap" variable

      • addTasksLocations

        private void addTasksLocations()
        Gets all the tasks from the database and adds a marker and a circle to the map for each one, it also adds the latitude and longitude of the location to the geofences list

        private void addGeofence(java.util.ArrayList<com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng> latLngList,
                         float radius)
        Parameters:
        latLngList - The list of all the latitudes and longitudes of the tasks location
        radius - The radius of the geofence

      • getGeofencingRequest

        private com.google.android.gms.location.GeofencingRequest getGeofencingRequest(java.util.ArrayList<com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng> latLngList,
                                                                               float radius)
        Creates a list of geofences with the locations of "latLngList" and then returns a created request for adding these geofences
        Parameters:
        latLngList - The list of all the latitudes and longitudes of the tasks location
        radius - The radius of the geofence
        Returns:
        {GeofencingRequest} The geofencing request (with the list of geofences created)

        Parameters:

        zoom - The zoom level

      • getMarkerIcon

        public com.google.android.gms.maps.model.BitmapDescriptor getMarkerIcon(java.lang.String color)
        Changes the color of the marker icon to the color of the task
        Parameters:
        color - The color of the task
        Returns:
        {BitmapDescriptor} The marker with the color of the task (unless it's black or gray, then it returns a purple marker)
